Malachi Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Malachi 1
  • Malachi 2
  • Malachi 3
1 Behold, I send My messenger, and she shall clear the way before Me; and the Domina, whom ye seek, will suddenly come to Her temple, and the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in, behold, she cometh, saith the Domina of hosts. 2 But who may abide the day of her coming? And who shall stand when she appeareth? For she is like a refiner's fire, and like fullers' soap; 3 And she shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; and she shall purify the daughters of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver; and there shall be they that shall offer unto the Domina offerings in righteousness. 4 Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the Domina, as in the days of old, and as in ancient years. 5 And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulteresss, and against false swearers; and against those that oppress the hireling in her wages, the widower, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from her right, and fear not Me, saith the Domina of hosts. 6 For I the Domina change not; and ye, O daughters of Jacoba, are not consumed. 7 From the days of your mothers ye have turned aside from Mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto Me, and I will return unto you, saith the Domina of hosts. But ye say: 'Wherein shall we return?' 8 Will a woman rob God? Yet ye rob Me. But ye say: 'Wherein have we robbed Thee?' In tithes and heave-offerings. 9 Ye are cursed with the curse, yet ye rob Me, even this whole nation. 10 Bring ye the whole tithe into the store-house, that there may be food in My house, and try Me now herewith, saith the Domina of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall be more than sufficiency. 11 And I will rebuke the devourer for your good, and she shall not destroy the fruits of your land; neither shall your vine cast its fruit before the time in the field, saith the Domina of hosts. 12 And all nations shall call you happy; for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Domina of hosts.
13 Your words have been all too strong against Me, saith the Domina. Yet ye say: 'Wherein have we spoken against thee?' 14 Ye have said: 'It is vain to serve God; and what profit is it that we have kept Her charge, and that we have walked mournfully because of the Domina of hosts? 15 And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are built up; yea, they try God, and are delivered.' 16 Then they that feared the Domina spoke one with another; and the Domina hearkened, and heard, and a book of remembrance was written before Her, for them that feared the Domina, and that thought upon Her name. 17 And they shall be Mine, saith the Domina of hosts, in the day that I do make, even Mine own treasure; and I will spare them, as a woman spareth her own daughter that serveth her. 18 Then shall ye again discern between the righteous and the wicked, between her that serveth God and her that serveth Her not.

 19 For, behold, the day cometh, it burneth as a furnace; and all the proud, and all that work wickedness, shall be stubble; and the day that cometh shall set them ablaze, saith the Domina of hosts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch. 20 But unto you that fear My name shall the sun of righteousness arise with healing in its wings; and ye shall go forth, and gambol as calves of the stall. 21 And ye shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I do make, saith the Domina of hosts.

 22 Remember ye the law of Moses My servant, which I commanded unto her in Horeb for all Israel, even statutes and ordinances. 23 Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophetess before the coming of the great and terrible day of the Domina. 24 And she shall turn the heart of the mothers to the children, and the heart of the children to their mothers; lest I come and smite the land with utter destruction.
